diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Inflammatory pseudotumor of the urinary bladder
differential_diagnosis: Inflammatory pseudotumor (considered as the final diagnosis)
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with gross hematuria and a bladder mass. Cystoscopic findings indicated a mass with a smooth surface and gel-like consistency. Pathological examination after transurethral resection showed characteristics typical of inflammatory pseudotumor, including mesenchymal proliferation without cytologic atypia, differentiating it from sarcoma and indicating a benign nature.
